title: Lakshmi
summary: Lakshmi (/ˈlʌkʃmi/;[5][nb 1] Sanskrit: लक्ष्मी, romanized: Lakṣmī, lit. 'she who leads to one's goal'), also known as Shri (Sanskrit: श्री, romanized: Śrī, lit. 'Noble'),[7] is one of the principal goddesses in Hinduism. She is the goddess of wealth, fortune, power, beauty and prosperity,[8] and associated with Maya ("Illusion"). Along with Parvati and Saraswati, she forms the Tridevi of Hindu goddesses.[9]
